definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: He has also set eternity in the hearts of men; yet they cannot fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 然而神从始至终的作为，人不能参透。

sentences.english: For a hundred years, I am the premier to perceive big have no mutually the human of hand.
sentences.chinese: 百年来，我是第一位参透大无相手的人。

sentences.english: I've divined the mysteries of death, and seen its truth.
sentences.chinese: 我已经参透了死亡的秘境，并且看到了它的实质。

sentences.english: Fortuneteller, what do you see future in a card?
sentences.chinese: 算命人，你在牌上能把未来的什么参透？

sentences.english: Unlike his party’s flag-bearer, Mr Webb understands America’s warrior culture.
sentences.chinese: 与党内的执旗者不同，韦伯参透美国的勇士文化。

definition: to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
